arguments.title: EU AI Act – High‑Level Compliance Overview

sections.heading: What is the EU AI Act?
sections.body: The EU Artificial Intelligence Act (2024) establishes a legal framework for AI systems deployed in the European Union. It categorises AI into risk tiers and imposes obligations for high‑risk AI.

sections.heading: Key Definitions
sections.body:
• AI System: Software using machine‑learning, logic‑based or statistical approaches to generate outputs that influence the environment.
  • High‑risk AI: Systems that could affect health, safety or fundamental rights, such as biometric identification or critical‑infrastructure monitoring.

sections.heading: Core Obligations for High‑risk AI
sections.body:
1. Perform a comprehensive risk assessment before market placement.
  2. Maintain governance documentation (technical file, logbooks, post‑market monitoring).
  3. Provide transparency information to end‑users.
  4. Undergo conformity assessment by a notified body.
